intro: Citriobatus, commonly known as the citron gourd, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its large, yellowish-green, citrus-scented fruits that are often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. The plant features palmate leaves with lobed edges and produces yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers. Its vines are vigorous climbers, often requiring support structures for growth. The botanical structure of Citriobatus includes a fibrous root system and a hollow, branching stem.
